intro: Leretia vellozoi, commonly known as the Vellozoi's leretia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of soft hairs. Leretia vellozoi is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
